What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:

Which of the following best describes your mode of learning in this course?
options: virtual seminar or other discussion format
in-person seminar or other discussion format

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course? (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: I can't give enough reviews about this amazing class. It's life changing. I had a passion for medical oncology prior to taking TCB. However, following this course, I wish I could be practicing right now. The molecular aspects of cancer formation are so intricate, like a beautifully-choreographed yet insidious dance. I was amazed at how each lecture Dean Chang gave taught a separate aspect of cancer, but they were all woven together beautifully throughout the course. As for Dean Chang, WOW. I was shy before entering this class. Through the encouraging way he ran class, I was never afraid of giving a wrong answer or being judged in any way, shape, or form. I am leaving this class as a confident, introspective individual who feels ready to tackle the world. Thank you, Yale, for allowing this class to be offered. Thank you, Dean Chang, for your amazing reassurance in my abilities and personality.
Foundational knowledge in cancer biology and history of cancer research.

Scientific protocol, how to perform biological assays, when to perform them, what they signify, identifying strengths and weaknesses of scientific papers, identifying a researcher's aims, learning about cancer biology in depth.
A wonderful introduction to the biological and biochemical principles of cancer formation. Learned how to read primary literature, make presentations, design research proposals and experiments.
Critical thinking, scientific reasoning, data analysis, writing, scientific presentation skills, scientific knowledge
How to read, analyze, and comprehend scientific papers, learning how to write grant proposals, and various cancer biology topics such as cancer pathways, drug development, etc.
I learned so much about not only the biological background about cancer, but the historical significance of each cancer break through through history which was very interesting.

I learned so much about various aspects of cancer, from the basic science to promising therapies to successful preventative measures. This class is so thought-provoking and introduces you to incredible landmark papers + trials in cancer biology. Dean Chang is great at teaching us how to read papers, ask important questions, and design our own experiments.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved? (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: The strength of this course was the way Dean Chang conducted class. Everyone was constantly encouraged to express themselves through textbook-intellectual, artistic, and musical means. He has the vibrant personality of the ideal professor. If you test the waters of speaking in class, I guarantee you will only be rewarded through the encouragement you will receive. There is no wrong answer in Dean Chang's class!
This was a wonderful course. No improvements needed.

Dean Chang is the best teacher I have ever had. His discussion format, thought-provoking PSET questions, and the overall organization of the course were very well curated and developed. This is the best science class I have ever taken.

This course is extremely organized and the material discussed is extremely interesting. The professors also assigns us very unique assignments that cannot be taught in other courses. I knew well ahead of time the tasks that were asked of me.

This course is really well-designed. Some of my highlights include reading the Emperor of All Maladies, Dean Chang's lectures, working on the psets, and listening to student presentations on their research. I really appreciated that Dean Chang put us all into groups, which ensured we could easily make friends and have a good support system in the class despite the Zoom format. Honestly, can't think of any weaknesses. Incredible class.

narratives.question_text: Among the practices in this course geared toward learning during the COVID-19 pandemic, which succeeded and which could be improved? Please comment on course practices that allowed for virtual engagement. (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: While there were shortcomings due to the online format, all appropriate adjustments were made and the learning experience was optimized.

Dean Chang was extremely empathetic and understanding regarding the COVID-19 pandemic. Giving extensions and canceling some PSETS and exams to convert to a more online-friendly environment made the class extremely enjoyable without taking away intellectual rigor.
The course was well-suited to the pandemic. The lectures were always recorded, and the assignments due were always clearly outlined in the syllabus ahead of time.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain. (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: I would certainly recommend this course to another student! I believe the student needs to be very science-oriented and will get the most out of the course if they have a passion to either conduct cancer research in the future, become an oncologist, or has a strong intellectual curiosity for molecular mechanisms/physiological initiation and response to cancer.

I would recommend this course to anyone pursuing a career related to biology. It has easily been the best class I have ever taken. The insight gained, analytical skills developed, and overall knowledge from this course has been incomparable to any other course I have taken.
Yes, 100% yes! Dean Chang is amazing and this seminar will be one of the best you ever have.

Yes. This course is extremely unique and is one of a kind. It has exposed me to material I would not have known before hand, and has taught me unique skills that I would not have learnt in other courses. The small, intimate class setting is the perfect opportunity to learn from the professor and from other students. Unlike other introductory STEM classes, this course is extremely engaging. I loved this class and highly encourage others to enroll.

Yes. The effort that you put into this class would generally determine how much you'll enjoy and grow throughout the class and it will all pay off at the end. Don't take this class just for credit. Take it because you genuinely want to learn.
Yes!
Yes, definitely take this!!! This is my favorite class I've taken so far at Yale, and Dean Chang is awesome. I'm sure it will be even more fun in person in the next few semesters.

narratives.question_text: Please list any other mode(s) of learning, including any combination or variation of the above options.
comments: Dean Chang also hosted weekly office hours that were very informative and helpful!
All our sections were live virtual lectures.
Office hours
